member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ActualDpiProperty
member.summary: Gets the actual DPI, which is a function of DefaultDpi and Dpi. This property ultimately determines the DPI scaling applied to CrispIMages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ActualGrayscaleBiasColorProperty
member.summary: The actual grayscale bias.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ActualHighContrastProperty
member.summary: This is a function of HighContrast and SystemHighContrast. This property ultimately determines whether the image is rendered high-contrast.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ActualImageLibraryProperty
member.summary: The actual image library is a function of DefaultImageLibrary and ImageLibrary. This property ultimately determines the image library from which images are loaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.DefaultImageLibraryProperty
member.summary: Exposes a PropertyInfo for the DefaultImageLibrary property, so that the static property can be used in PropertyPaths for bindings created in code.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.DpiProperty
member.summary: Defines the DPI used by the CrispImages which are descendants of the element to which this property is attached. If this is 0.0, DefaultDpi is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.GrayscaleBiasColorProperty
member.summary: Defines the grayscale bias color used by the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which this property is attached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.GrayscaleProperty
member.summary: Defines the grayscale color used by the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which this property is attached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.HighContrastProperty
member.summary: Determine whether the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which thisproperty is attached show high-contrast images. The values are as follows:True - Images are high-contrastFalse - Images are not high-contrastnull - Images are displayed according to the system high-contrast setting

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ImageLibraryProperty
member.summary: Defines the image library used by the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which this property is attached. If this is null, DefaultImageLibrary is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.MonikerProperty
member.summary: The moniker to use when loading the CrispImage's image from the image library.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ScaleFactorProperty
member.summary: The ScaleFactor that is used when the image may be scaled using a transform, such as for an image in the editor margin when the zoom != 100%. A ScaleFactor of 1 does no scaling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.SystemHighContrastProperty
member.summary: The value of SystemParameters.HighContrast. It is defined as a dependency property so that it can be used in a binding to set the value of ActualHighContrast.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.BeforeImageRealized
member.summary: Raised before an image is realized from it source. If the image is realized by retrieving it from the cache, this event is not raised.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.DefaultGrayscaleBiasColor
member.summary: The default color for biasing grayscale images (#40FFFFFF). This produces a 75% translucent effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.HighContrastGrayscaleBiasColor
member.summary: The color for biasing grayscale images when in high-contrast mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.InvalidImageMoniker
member.summary: The invalid image moniker. Images using this moniker cannot be loaded from an image manifest.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.NeutralSize
member.summary: The size to use when specifying a size-neutral image in a call to AddCustomImage. The size-neutral image is the image that is scaled to the requested size when an image of the requested size is not available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities.ImageBackgroundColorProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used for image theming. The target color is used to map the "halo" color in an image with the target background color. It should be attached on the same UIElement that the gackground color is set on when images are drawn directly on that Background. The reasons why the background is not used directly:1. Backgrounds that are set to Transparent would require a visual tree walk to find the real background.2. The background is a Brush, not a Color, which would require interpretation to arrive at a Color instead.3. The ultimate background the image is drawn on may not be the desired image to use for theming, for example when a selection brush is conditionally shown in a TreeView.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities.ThemeScrollBarsProperty
member.summary: Controls whether the ScrollBars of this element and its descendants have themed scrollbars. It is attached to FrameworkElementTrue - ScrollBars are themedFalse - ScrollBars are not themednull - ScrollBar theme state is inherited

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageConverter.ExtractPixelSection(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Int32Rect)
member.summary: Extracts a section from a 32bit or 24bit pixel buffer, up-converting to 32bit opaque if necessary. Special colors Green-1 and Magenta are translated into transparent pixels, and all transparent pixels are then be made black.
member.param: Thes pixel size of the source image.
The width in bytes of a pixel row in the source image.
The rectangle to extract from the source image, indicates the width/height of the result.
member.returns: The destination pixel buffer of an image with the dimensions of the passed-in rect and a stride of Width*4 (32bpp).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageConverter.ExtractPixelSection(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Int32Rect,System.Drawing.Color[])
member.summary: This method extracts a section from a 32bit or 24bit pixel buffer, up-converting to 32bit opaque if necessary. Colors matching one of the transparent colors are translated into transparent pixels, and all transparent pixels are then be made black.
member.param: Thes pixel size of the source image.
The width in bytes of a pixel row in the source image.
The rectangle to extract from the source image, indicates the width/height of the result.
An array of colors that represent transparency in the source.
member.returns: The destination pixel buffer of an image with the dimensions of the passed in rect and a stride of Width*4 (32bpp).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.AddCustomCompositeImage(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.Int16Size,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Interop.ImageCompositionLayer[])
member.summary: Creates a custom image that is composed of multiple other images, and adds that image to the library.
member.param: The virtual size of the canvas representing the image. This does not represent a pixel size, and is used as a point of reference for each image layer.
The stack of images to render. Later images in the array are drawn on top of previous images.
member.returns: A handle that contains the moniker associated with the image. The handle maintains the object lifetime of the image itself. Allowing the handle to be garbage-collected will result in the image also being GC-eligible.

member.returns: A handle which contains the moniker associated with the image. The handle maintains the object lifetime of the image itself. Allowing the handle to be garbage-collected will result in the image also being GC-eligible.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities.GetOrCreateThemedBitmapSource(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource,System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Converts an input BitmapSource into an BitmapSource that blends in with the target background. This converter performs two conversions.1. The luminosity of the image is transformed so that the constant "halo" luminosity blends in with the background. This has the effect of eliminating the halo visually. The "halo" luminosity is an immutable constant, and is not calculated from the input image.2. The image is converted to grayscale if the isEnabled parameter is false. This uses the "biasColor" to determine how to transform the image to grayscale.
member.param: The color which the halo color should be targeted to match within the bitmap.
True if the bitmap should be rendered enabled, false if it should be disabled (grayscaled).
The color used for biasing grayscale if the image is disabled.
member.returns: A new BitmapSource with the requested transformations applied.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image library used for CrispImage objects that don't have their ImageLibrary property set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.Dpi
member.summary: Defines the DPI used by the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which this property is attached. If this is 0.0, DefaultDpi is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.HighContrast
member.summary: Determines whether the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which this property is attached show high-contrast images.
member.returns: The values are as follows:True - Images are high-contrastFalse - Images are not high-contrastnull - Images are displayed according to the system high-contrast setting

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ImageLibrary
member.summary: Defines the image library used by the CrispImage objects that are descendants of the element to which this property is attached. If this is null, DefaultImageLibrary is used.

member.summary: Gets the moniker to use when loading the CrispImage's image from the image library.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets the ScaleFactor that is used when the image may be scaled using a transform, such as for an image in the editor margin when the zoom != 100%. A ScaleFactor of 1 does no scaling.

member.summary: The manifest's PackageGuid, if it is specified in the manifest. If the manifest has no PackageGuid attribute, this is Guid.Empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities.ImageBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used for image theming. The target color is used to map the "halo" color in an image with the target background color. It should be attached on the same UIElement that the gackground color is set on when images are drawn directly on that Background. The reasons why the background is not used directly:1. Backgrounds that are set to Transparent would require a visual tree walk to find the real background.2. The background is a Brush, not a Color, which would require interpretation to arrive at a Color instead.3. The ultimate background the image is drawn on may not be the desired image to use for theming, for example when a selection brush is conditionally shown in a TreeView.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities.ThemeScrollBars
member.summary: Controls whether the ScrollBars of this element and its descendants have themed scrollbars. It is attached to FrameworkElementTrue - ScrollBars are themedFalse - ScrollBars are not themednull - ScrollBar theme state is inherited

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ActualDpiConverter
member.summary: Converts a possibly-uninitialized DPI value into a valid DPI.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ActualGrayscaleBiasColorConverter
member.summary: Determines the correct value for the grayscale bias color for a CrispImage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ActualHighContrastConverter
member.summary: Determines whether or not to use high-contrast images.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ActualImageLibraryConverter
member.summary: Converts a possibly-null ImageLibrary into a valid ImageLibrary for image retrieval.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.BitmapLocker
member.summary: A disposable helper class that helps lock and unlock bitmap bits.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Converters.ImageMonikerToCrispImageConverter
member.summary: Converts an ImageMoniker into a CrispImage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.CrispImage
member.summary: An Image class that gets its source from the image library and renders it crisply at any DPI setting. This class is sealed to prevent initialization problems stemming from the Created event, which can call outside the class and could result in derived classes not being initialized yet.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Dpi.DpiPrescaledImageExtension
member.summary: This class is derived from a MarkupExtension class that can be used to declare image sources in XAML and have the image pre-scaled for High DPI at zoom levels higher than 200%, using NearestNeighbor up to the largest multiple of 100%.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Dpi.DpiPrescaleImageSourceConverter
member.summary: Converts an ImageSource into another ImageSource, pre-scaled on High DPI to the largest zoom multiple of 100% smaller than the DPI zoom.///

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Dpi.DpiPrescaleThemedImageConverter
member.summary: Converts an ImageSource into an Image element. If the input image ia a BitmapSource, the transformed BitmapSource has its halo color mapped to the given background color and is conditionally rendered as disabled. The resultant image is then pre-scaled on High DPI to the largest zoom multiple of 100% smaller than the DPI zoom. This converter chains the behavior of ThemedImageConverter and DpiPrescaleImageSourceConverter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Dpi.DpiPrescaleThemedImageSourceConverter
member.summary: Converts an ImageSource into another ImageSource. If the input image ia a BitmapSource, the transformed BitmapSource has its halo color mapped to the given background color and is conditionally rendered as disabled. The resultant image is then pre-scaled on High DPI to the largest zoom multiple of 100% smaller than the DPI zoom.This converter chains the behavior of ThemedImageSourceConverter and DpiPrescaleImageSourceConverter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ExtensionMethods
member.summary: Provides imaging extension methods.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageConverter
member.summary: Provides helper methods for image conversion.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for ImageLibrary events.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImagingUtilities
member.summary: Provides helper methods for imaging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ManifestDescriptor
member.summary: Describes a manifest file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.GrayscaleBitmapSourceConverter
member.summary: Converts an image BitmapSource into a grayscale version of the same image.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.GrayscaleImageConverter
member.summary: Microsoft internal use only. This class converts a BitmapSource into an Image control whose Source property is set to a grayscale version of the input image. The grayscale version is generated by GrayscaleBitmapSourceConverter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities
member.summary: Contains utility methods for grayscaling and transforming color spaces within images.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ImageThemingUtilities.ModifyPixelCallback
member.summary: A callback used to modify pixel data in a BitmapSource.
member.param: The BitmapSource whose pixels are being modified.
The Bgra32 pixel values from the BitmapSource.
member.returns: True if the bitmap was modified, false if no change were made.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ThemedImageConverter
member.summary: Microsoft internal use only. Converts an input ImageSource into an Image control whose Source blends in with the target background.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.ThemedImageSourceConverter
member.summary: Microsoft internal use only. Converts an ImageSource into another ImageSource. If the input image ia a BitmapSource, the transformed BitmapSource has its halo color mapped to the given background color and is conditionally rendered as disabled.
